question: When you put your aircraft away at night the altimeter set to the elevation of the airport reads 520 feet. During the night a low pressure area moves over the airport and the atmospheric pressure drops sharply. On checking the altimeter the next morning you would expect the indicated altitude to be
answers: the same as the current altimeter setting.

answers: friction between the air and the ground.

clockwise around a high and counter-clockwise around a low.

a region of relatively low pressure with the lowest pressure at the centre

question: A steep pressure gradient indicates

answers: to the left of the track

to lose altitude rapidly while in the saddle
to gain altitude rapidly on the east side of the saddle
